subject: Mental Health
title: The Thin Ideal Through History
description: A 60-second lesson on The Thin Ideal Through History.

hook.text: Marilyn Monroe was a size 12. Today's models are thinner than 95 percent of the population.

buildup.text: Beauty ideals have shifted dramatically across cultures and centuries.

discovery.text: The thin ideal emerged in Western culture in the 1960s with Twiggy and the fashion industry.

twist.text: Cultures without Western media exposure have significantly lower eating disorder rates.

climax.text: When Fiji got television in 1995, eating disorders appeared within three years.

punchline.text: Change the images a culture sees and you change the bodies it rejects.

quiz.question: What happened after television was introduced in Fiji in 1995?
options: Eating disorders appeared within three years
